definition: to beat a drum/to play a drum/(fig.) to feel nervous
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]

sentences.english: The villagers beat drums and lit firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 村民们敲锣打鼓放鞭炮。

sentences.english: Jack drums for the school band.
David, I won't have you play the drum in my study room.
sentences.chinese: 大卫，我不许你在我的书房冬冬地不住打鼓。

sentences.english: He blew the trumpet and used drum to let people hear him before he started preaching.
sentences.chinese: 在他开始讲道之前，他会吹喇叭并打鼓来让人听见。

sentences.english: If you didn�t play drums which instrument would you play? (by Davide)
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有打鼓，会演奏哪种乐器？

sentences.english: Open here I flung the shutter, when, with many a flirt and flutter.
sentences.chinese: 我猛然推开窗户，心儿扑扑直跳就像打鼓。

sentences.english: Later, he also learned to play the guitar and drums. When Yl ?
sentences.chinese: 后来，他还学会了弹吉他和打鼓。

sentences.english: There were old people , young people; they beat the drums through the day.
sentences.chinese: 其中有老人，也有年轻人，他们整天都在敲锣打鼓。

sentences.english: The drummer needs to be comfortable with the feel of the beater hitting the head.
sentences.chinese: 鼓手需要一个非常舒适的踩锤击打鼓皮的感觉。

sentences.english: There are dragon dances with drums.
sentences.chinese: 也会敲锣打鼓的舞龙灯。

sentences.english: Can you play the piano, the trumpet, the drums, or the violin?
sentences.chinese: 你会弹钢琴，吹喇叭，打鼓或者是拉小提琴吗？

sentences.english: Drumming is not the way to catch a hare.
sentences.chinese: 靠敲锣打鼓抓不到兔子。

sentences.english: Star actor Soo-ta lives behind a veil, away from public eyes.
sentences.chinese: 演员秀打鼓生活背后的面纱，远离公众的眼睛。

sentences.english: I'll break your neck if you don't stop playing those drums.
sentences.chinese: 你不停止打鼓，我就要扭断你的脖子。

sentences.english: In China, people may play the gong and the drum during the traditional festivals.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，人们在逢年过节时会敲锣打鼓。

definition: to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain
unsure/uncertain/unending
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
nervous/apprehensive
(onom.) beating of the heart/pitapat/pulsation of a machine
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
at sixes and sevens/perturbed state of mind/in a mess
restless/apprehensive
to feel weak/to be diffident
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
to become agitated/to feel nervous
think to oneself
variant of 發怵|发怵[fa1 chu4]
laugh in (up) one's sleeve/snigger/snicker
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
